PIT_PKG Body

Implements the core PIT logic.

Author

Juergen Sieben, ConDeS GmbH

Published under MIT licence

Private type declarations
module_list_type

List of output modules of type PIT_MODULE, indexed by pit_util.ora_name_type.

call_stack_tab

Type to store a list of call_stack_type instances. Indexed by pls_integer.

client_info_t

Subtype of VARCHAR2, limited to 64 byte.

Private constants
Private constants
C_PARAM_GROUP

Name of the parameter group for PIT

C_BASE_MODULE

Typename of the abstract output module

C_WARN_IF_UNUSABLE_MODULES

Parameter name that controls if PIT warns in case a module is unusable

C_LOG_STATE_THRESHOLD

Parameter name that holds the default threshold for the log_state method

Private context constants
C_GLOBAL_CONTEXT

Name of the global context name for PIT

C_CONTEXT_TYPE

Paramter that holds the type of the global context

C_CONTEXT_DEFAULT

Name of the default context

C_CONTEXT_ACTIVE

Name of the active context

C_ALLOW_TOGGLE

Name of the parameter that holds the allow toggle flag

Private adapter constants
C_ADAPTER_PREFERENCE

Name of the parameter that stores the adapter preference

C_ADAPTER_OK

Flag to indicate that the adapter is usable

"event"" constants
C_CONTEXT_EVENT

Context changed event

C_LOG_EVENT

Log event

C_PURGE_EVENT

Purge event

C_PRINT_EVENT

Print event

C_ENTER_EVENT

Enter event

C_LEAVE_EVENT

Leave event

C_NOTIFY_EVENT

Notify event

C_LOG_STATE_EVENT

Log state event

Private global variable declarations
Package variables
g_all_modules

List of all output modules that are installed

g_available_modules

List of all modules which are available for logging (meaning: status = msg.MODULE_INSTANTIATED)

g_active_modules

List of all modules which are available and actually registered for logging

g_context

Actual context settings

g_active_message

Actual message. Stored globally to allow for reuse of last raised message

g_call_stack

Global variable to store the call stack

g_warn_if_unusable_modules

Cache parameter C_WARN_IF_UNUSABLE_MODULES

g_active_adapter

Adapter in use (Default Adapter or any other adapter as preferred by parameter C_ADAPTER_PREFERENCE

g_user_name

Actual username to avoid roundtrips to SQL function USER

g_client_id

Instance of client_info_t holding information about the actually connencted client

g_collect_mode

Flag to indicate whether PIT is in collect mode

g_message_stack

List of messages raised since PIT is in collect mode

g_collect_least_severity

Least severity so far (meaning the most severe message)

g_stop_bulk_on_fatal

Flag to indicate whether collect mode has to be left if a fatal exception occurs

g_log_state_threshold

Cache for parameter C_LOG_STATE_THRESHOLD

Private module maintenance methods
report_module_status
procedure report_module_status

Reports all modules that have not been loaded succesfully if requested by parameter C_WARN_IF_UNUSABLE_MODULES

Is called after initialization of the output modules.  Emits warnings for any module that has not been loaded succesfully if set to do so.

get_modules_by_name
function get_modules_by_name(
p_requested_modules in varchar2
)
return module_list_type

Copies all requested and available output module instances into a module list. These modules will then be used to log to.

Parameter
p_requested_modules
in varchar2

Colon-separated list of requested output modules

Returns

Collection of type MODULE_LIST_TYPE with all available and requested module instances

Private context maintenance methods
read_best_matching_context
function read_best_matching_context(
p_args in args default null
)
return pit_util.context_type

Method to read the actually chosen context from the global context. Is used to read the actual settings, as they may have changed based on settings in other sessions.

Context are stored under their name in the global context. This method tries to read the context values of the passed in context name. If it can't find any, it falls back to the active context and if no active context exists, to the default context.

Parameter
p_args
in args

Optional (list of) context name(s). If NULL, ACTIVE and DEFAULT contexts are searched in that order, otherwise the passed in (list of) context name has highest priority.

Returns

Actual context settings.

Errors
-20000

if no context settings were found.

copy_context_to_global
procedure copy_context_to_global(
p_context_name in varchar2 default null
)

Reads actual context settings into G_CONTEXT and decides whether a change in the settings has occurred.

Is called to read the log settings from the globally accessed context. It tries to read the context in the following order:

  • CONTEXT_FROM SESSION_ADAPTER,

  • P_CONTEXT_NAME,

  • C_ACTIVE_CONTEXT,

  • C_DEFAULT_CONTEXT

After having read the actual settings, it compares them to the settings known so far.  If they differ, <pit_util.context_type.CTX_CHANGED> is set to TRUE and to FALSE otherwise.

Parameter
p_context_name
in varchar2

Optional context name.

Returns

Session context, if required, named context if requested, active context if available, default context otherwise.

copy_actual_context_to_global
procedure copy_actual_context_to_global

Retrieves the actually valid context settings and copies it to G_CONTEXT.

Is used as a wrapper around COPY_CONTEXT_TO_GLOBAL. This method reads the actual context first to find out whether the session adapter requires a context change. If yes, this context is read.

set_context_if_changed
procedure set_context_if_changed(
p_context in pit_util.context_type
)

Stores new context settings for PIT at the global context and raises C_CONTEXT_EVENT event.

Is called from pit.SET_CONTEXT to actually persist the required settings in the global context and raise a context switch event.

This method examines whether a context change has happened by comparing  the context settings with the latest stored settings from G_CONTEXT. If a change has occurred, it stores the new values

  • at the globally accessed context to propagate the settings to other sessions

  • within global variable G_CONTEXT to allow for a comparison later

It also loads the active output modules.

Parameter
p_context
in pit_util.context_type

New context settings, instance of pit_util.context_type

set_context_temporarily
procedure set_context_temporarily(
p_old_context out nocopy pit_util.context_type,
p_new_context in pit_util.context_type
)

Method to persist existings context settings in <P_OLD_CONTEXT> and set the active context according to the settings.

Is used if for a single log activity a new context setting is required, such as with <pit.LOG_SPECIFIC> or pit.NOTIFY.  In this environment, only output modules and log threshold can be changed, therefore all other settings are copied from the actually active context. Used in conjunction with RESET_TEMPORARILY_SET_CONTEXT

Parameters
p_old_context
out nocopy pit_util.context_type

Instance of PIT_UTIL.context_type to hold the existing context settings and a flag on whether the context was changed by this method

p_new_context
in pit_util.context_type

partly filled new context (log_level and module_list may be filled)

reset_temporarily_set_context
procedure reset_temporarily_set_context(
p_context in pit_util.context_type
)

Method to reset a temporarlily set context back to its original settings.  Is used to reset a temporarily context switch back. Used in conjunction with SET_CONTEXT_TEMPORARILY

Parameter
p_context
in pit_util.context_type

Context settings of the context before the temporarily shift

get_toggle_context
function get_toggle_context(
p_module in pit_util.ora_name_type,
p_method in pit_util.ora_name_type
)
return pit_util.context_type

Checks whether a toggle for a given package/method exists.

A toggle controls whether PIT should log or not. Therefore it must be checked whether a toggle was defined for the actual package/method the call stack is at. If a setting is present, this method will set the new environment and return the settings at the same time to store them in the call stack.  This is necessary to reset it if the call stack entry is popped.

Parameters
p_module
in pit_util.ora_name_type

Name of the package that toggles log settings

p_method
in pit_util.ora_name_type

Name of the method that toggles log settings. If NULL, any method within <P_MODULE> will toggle.

Returns

Context with settings for PACKAGE.METHOD, PACKAGE, ACTIVE or DEFAULT CONTEXT

reset_toggle_context
procedure reset_toggle_context(
p_settings in varchar2
)

Resets toggle context settings. If a toggle was found and the call stack pops that entry, the log settings outside the toggle must be restored.

Parameter
p_settings
in varchar2

Context settings to set the context to

check_context_toggle
function check_context_toggle(
p_trace_settings in varchar2,
p_last_entry in pls_integer
)
return pit_util.context_type

Checks whether log settings have to be changed due to toggle settings

Parameters
p_trace_settings
in varchar2

Potentially new settings if a toggle exists

p_last_entry
in pls_integer

Reference to the last call stack entry from which the context settings are copied

get_context_list
procedure get_context_list

Reads all predefined context and toggles from parameters and stores it in globally accessed context.  Method is invoked during initialization to copy parameter settings for access across sessions.

Private adapter maintenance methods
load_adapter
procedure load_adapter

Loads and instantiates an adapter to read client information.

Procedure loads and instantiates adapters which are created under PIT_DEFAULT_ADAPTER plus PIT_DEFAULT_ADAPTER itself.

Which modules are instantiated depends on parameter C_ADAPTER_PREFERENCE.

LOAD_ADAPTER tries to instantiate the adpaters in the order specified in the parameter and stops upon first successful instantiation.

The instantiated module provides information about the actual environment.

Private call stack maintenance methods
maintain_application_info
procedure maintain_application_info(
p_module in varchar2,
p_action in varchar2,
p_client_info in varchar2
)

Helper to maintain Application Info. Called from <PUSH_STACK>/<POP_STACK> methods.

Parameters
p_module
in varchar2

Module that was called

p_action
in varchar2

Method of the module that was called

p_client_info
in varchar2

Client info passed in as optional parameter

push_stack
procedure push_stack(
p_module in varchar2,
p_action in varchar2,
p_client_info in varchar2,
p_params in msg_params,
p_trace_level in pls_integer,
p_trace_settings in varchar2
)

Method to push an entrie to the call stack. Called from the ENTER method.

Parameters
p_module
in varchar2

Module that was called

p_action
in varchar2

Method of the module that was called

p_client_info
in varchar2

Optional client info passed in as a pararameter to ENTER

p_params
in msg_params

Parameter list of parameters passed to the method

p_trace_level
in pls_integer

Trace level of the entry

p_trace_settings
in varchar2

In case of toggles trace settings may change. The new settings are passed in here

pop_stack
procedure pop_stack(
p_params in msg_params,
p_call_stack in out nocopy call_stack_type,
p_new_trace_settings out nocopy varchar2
)

Method to pop an entry from the call stack. Called from <LEAVE>-method.

Parameters
p_params
in msg_params

Parameter list of parameters passed to the method

p_call_stack
in out nocopy call_stack_type

Instance of call_stack_type to pop from the stack

p_new_trace_settings
out nocopy varchar2

In case of toggles trace settings may change. The new settings are passed in here

Returns

Last entry found on the call stack. Used to maintain timing etc.

clean_stack
procedure clean_stack(
p_params in msg_params
)

Helper method to clean stack after a fatal error has ocurred. Called from method HANDLE_ERROR if level is <C_LEVEL_FATAL>. Pops all call stack entries.

Parameter
p_params
in msg_params

Instance of msg_params, used to add output parameters to the leave message

Private methods
get_language
function get_language
return varchar2

Helper method to retrieve the actual session language

Returns

Language string as per oracle convention: AMERICAN|GERMN etc.

push_message
procedure push_message(
p_message in out nocopy message_type
)

Pushes a method on the message stack if in message collection mode.

Parameter
p_message
in out nocopy message_type

Message to push onto the stack

Core functionality private methods
raise_event
procedure raise_event(
p_event in pls_integer,
p_message in message_type default null,
p_call_stack in call_stack_type default null,
p_log_state in log_state_type default null,
p_context in pit_util.context_type default null,
p_date_before in date default null,
p_severity_lower_equal in pls_integer default null
)

Central method to distribute any message to all actively parameterized output modules.  Called internally as a generic helper to throw messages to output modules

Parameters
p_event
in pls_integer

Integer indicating the type of "event" (i.e. <C_LOG_EVENT>|<C_PRINT_EVENT>|<C_ENTER_EVENT> etc.) thrown by PIT

p_call_stack
in call_stack_type

Instance of the actual call stack in the event of <C_ENTER_EVENT>|<C_LEAVE_EVENT>

p_date_before
in date

Date indicating the point in time, up to when the log is to be purged

p_message
in message_type

Instance of type MESSAGE_TYPE: the message to raise

log_me
function log_me(
p_severity in pit_message.pms_pse_id%type
)
return boolean

Decides whether a message has to be logged.

Is called during logging to decide whether the actual settings allow for logging.  The decision is based on the requested log level as well as on settings in the global context.

Parameter
p_severity
in pit_message.pms_pse_id%type

log_level for which a decision is requested

Returns

Flag that indicates whether settings allow for logging (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

trace_me
function trace_me(
p_trace_level in integer
)
return boolean

Decides whether a message has to be traced.

Is called during logging to decide whether the actual settings allow for tracing.  The decision is based on the requested trace level as well as on settings in the global context.

Parameter
p_trace_level
in integer

trace_level for which a decision is requested

Returns

Flag that indicates whether settings allow for tracing (TRUE) or not (FALSE).
